result.execSummary:
The defendant Tomas H Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 28 days time served; Straight time. No electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.

No contact with the victim, IL and ML without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
No unsupervised contact with children 17 years of age and under.
Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.

Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Agent  to have access to all the defendant's electronic devices.
Keep agent apprized of make, model and plates of vehicle.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC for 10 years.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tomas H Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10/8/15 ck #335595 was returned by USPS unable to forward.
Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Tomas H Rivera in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Alejandra Klaric.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Maria L.
AMENDED COUNT:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 28 days time served; Straight time.   No electronic monitoring.   COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 4 MONTHS
   in the House of Correction.  No release privileges.
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim, IL and ML without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* No unsupervised contact with children 17 years of age and under.
* Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
* Agent  to have access to all the defendant's electronic devices.
* Keep agent apprized of make, model and plates of vehicle.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC for 10 years.

 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
from the victim, received and filed. lms

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Tomas H Rivera in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Amended Information received and filed.
Court ordered charge amended to 4th Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3m), a Class A misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, signed Felony Motion/Pretrial Scheduling Order.  
Motion hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Victor Centeno-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.

Defendant Tomas H Rivera in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dugan, Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tomas H Rivera in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Tomas H Rivera in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Tomas H Rivera in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Tomas H Rivera in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
